info.headline: Flood Advisory issued May 27 at 5:34AM EDT until May 28 at 8:00PM EDT by NWS Greenville-Spartanburg
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 1130 AM EDT THIS MORNING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is ongoing. * WHERE...Burke County, North Carolina. * WHEN...Until 1130 AM EDT Friday. * IMPACTS...Nuisance flooding of low-lying areas adjacent to streams including farmland, nurseries, boat-access ramps, and secondary roadways. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 528 AM EDT, Due to earlier heavy rainfall, Johns River has exceeded Action/Advisory Stage, causing nuisance flooding from Adako to Chesterfield. The river is currently at 9.37 feet and rising. Expect the river to crest between 10 and 10.5 feet later this morning. The river will gradually recede below the Action/Advisory Stage by this evening. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Chesterfield.
info.instruction: Stay away from riverbanks and boat-access areas during high flows and flooding or be swept away.
